data.title: Android support on all platforms
data.body:
A proposal for enabling full android support on Win, OSX, Linux.

All platforms can produce debug and release apks. (#31)
If devices are connected, attempt installation, with later versions of Android things get complicated.
The paths are available on all platforms, some platforms can use system installed programs and paths. (#81)
Support direct typing into the path fields (#536)
All the paths and settings will be put into project BuildSettings.json file. (#818)
The icon is a button with current icon, and the filename next to it. Pressing the icon button brings up a finder to seek a new icon. (#754)

The [x] Release Path checkbox signifies that the user wants to build a release apk. It is unselected by default. It can be made insensitive until a release path has a value. 
Make the "Release Path" be the place where the user stores the ant.properties which contains the keystore and password info to make a release apk.
If the user selects Release and does not provide needed keystore information, a debug apk is created.

Build Settings Android layout

App Name :            [_____________]
App Package :        [_____________]
Company Name :   [_____________]
Product Name :      [_____________]

Android SDK Path :
[____________________] [Choose]

Android API Level:
[____________________] [Refresh]

Ant Path :
[____________________] [Choose]

Java JDK Path :
[____________________] [Choose]

[x] Release Path :
[____________________] [Choose]

[____________________] [Icon]  

Would you like to know more?

data.title: Web View - requesting a non existing file crashes the editor
data.body: If the embedded web view requests an invalid file from the host via either file://path or atomic://path, the editor will crash.  It should instead return a 404.

data.title: Fix for Material and Scene dialogs
data.body: This fixes the issue where the new scene and the new material dialogs were re-using the new component dialog which has been changed.

data.title: new Material and new Scene use the wrong dialog
data.body: The new Material and new Scene dialogs are using the new component dialog instead of their own.  This is causing the template dropdown to appear where there are no templates.  This is basically a cosmetic issue since the elements can still be created.

data.title: Jm linux editor
data.body:
Builds a linux editor that will execute without adding or changing any other files.
Ace text editor window is docked into tab.
Ace editing is minimalistic, missing are backspace, delete, tab, arrow keys.
Added missing linux directory finder, absent mostly in the build dialog.
Fix android processing for linux, with SDK path set, it will produce debug apk.
Filled out some error handlers for linux.

data.title: pre-set compile on save for new TypeScript projects
data.body: To make things more seamless for new TypeScript projects, auto set the Compile on Save setting.  This is so that when you get a new project, you can just edit and run without needing to toggle any settings.

data.title: More integrated TypeScript compilation
data.body:
TypeScript compilation needs to be more integrated into the build process so that the files are auto-compiled whenever:
- The in-editor player is launched
- A build is kicked off from the editor
- A build is kicked off from the command line

Additionally, the *.ts and *.d.ts files need to be excluded from being bundled up in the build.

data.title: Fixed to get TypeDoc to run
data.body:
Fixes for getting TypeDoc to run
- Backed down the TypeDoc to v0.3.12
- removed a TS 1.8.x feature from the .d.ts that the old version of TypeDoc didn't like

data.title: Open editor content doesn't refresh if file is changed in the background
data.body:
If a file is open and something modifies it in the background, the editor should load the change (unless there are unsaved changes in the current editor buffer).

The question is, should this be automatic or an option?  Also, if it's not turned on, should the editor at least indicate that it no longer matches what's on the filesystem by putting the asterisk on the filename if the background file changed?

data.title: in-editor TypeScript compilation
data.body:
I'm going to go ahead and open up this PR since the in-editor typescript compilation appears to be functional...just needs a good testing.   Also testing in Windows (and Linux when the webviews work) since I've pretty much been doing this in OSX land.
### Changes
- New menu item Developer->Plugins->TypeScript->Compile on Save: on/off
  Clicking on this will toggle compile on save on or off which will compile the currently edited file when you save.  This value is persisted in your project preferences file.
- New menu item Developer->Plugins->TypeScript->Compile
  Clicking on this will compile all of the TypeScript in your project directory and display the results
- Updated the Web View command: EDITOR_SAVE_FILE to allow the web view to pass up a fully qualified path/filename and file contents and it will get saved to the filesystem.  I added in protections that will ignore the request if the filename/path does not reside within the project directory, or the filename/path contains ".." which could allow saving a file outside the directory.  Since theoretically, the web view could be pointed to an editor on the internet, it just adds a little safety
- The TypeScript compiler will first look for an Atomic.d.ts in the project directory and if it doesn't find one, will use the one in the app data folder.  This opens up the ability to have projects that are always up to date with the Atomic.d.ts.  However, if you want to use an external editor, you will still need to copy the Atomic.d.ts in
- If there is a tsconfig.json file in the root of the project, the extension will pull it in and add any additional files within the [files] section that the editor isn't aware of.
### Open issues
- Currently the Compile menu will only work if a web view editor is open since the TypeScript language service lives inside a web worker attached to the web views.  I experimented around with dynamically instantiating a web view from the editor script, but it doesn't appear the AtomicQuery is available from those dynamic web views.  The idea would be that if there isn't a web view open, an off-screen one could be loaded and used to compile
- For compiler errors, there isn't a way to click on the error and open and jump to that line...maybe as an enhancement in a later PR
- Currently you will need to compile your typescript prior to building/running.  It should be pretty easy to hook into the Project Start Player event to do that, but it would be nice to have the off-screen compiler working first
- A nice to have would be a menu that allows you to update your in-project copy of Atomic.d.ts with the latest from the app.

Phew!

data.title: Document setting up QtCreator4 for Atomic development on Windows
data.body:
Bookending issue with the relevant details for easy on eyes.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1652115/15770732/1d891b28-2923-11e6-8085-11b87b5d2ffe.png)

thankfully, QtCreator gave me the correct location of the c/cpp compiler as seen in picture above.
C:\Dev\Atomic32Bit\AtomicGameEngine>call "%VS140COMNTOOLS%....\VC\bin\amd64\cl.
exe"

the bat file references "amd64\vcvars.bat" which errors out.

**Similar issues** and concerns on user experience and building from source has been mentioned on _5 counts: **709, 555, 556 and forum comments 764, 731**_

note below several posts is a fantastic list of common cmake woes, i suggest we copy paste give credit and drop in a Troubleshooting area. I am happy to do this, just tell me.
found here: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/issues/834#issuecomment-223492305 source for list here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32801638/cmake-error-at-cmakelists-txt30-project-no-cmake-c-compiler-could-be-found

Old Title: windows 'stdbool.h':bool, 'atlbase.h':null, curl_slist\* headers = NULL;
...this issue turned into an attempt to improve new user experience on building from source.

trying QtCreator on Win 8, 64 bit.

Following this:
https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Building-the-Atomic-Editor-using-QtCreator

On Step 2:
Part: "From the Build menu, select Build All"

(note i couldn't get -j8 to be recognized but that doesn't seem to impact this issue, so i removed that part)

_C:\Users\User\Desktop\AtomicGameEngine\Source\ThirdParty\libcurl\lib\curl_setup_once.h:73: error: C1083: Cannot open include file: 'stdbool.h': No such file or directory_

checked, indeed it is not there.

when i did my git i did:
git clone --recursive https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine

also:
https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine
says...
"Please see Building the Atomic Editor from Source for Visual Studio 2013, XCode, and QtCreator build instructions."

but...https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Building-the-Atomic-Editor-from-Source
...link says
"1) Install VS2015 and cmake, making sure cmake is on your path"

..consistency?

data.title: Chrome dev tools no longer working with embedded web views
data.body:
The latest version of Chrome no longer can connect to the embedded web view.  This is due to the version of CEF using object.observe which has been depracated in the latest chrome.

The error occurring is:
`inspector.js:10744 Uncaught TypeError: Object.observe is not a function`

I believe updating CEF should resolve this issue.  As a workaround, attaching an older version of the Chromium web browser will work for now.

data.title: window.atomicQuery not available from instantiated WebClient
data.body: If you new up a WebView.WebClient instance, it doesn't seem to have the atomicQuery method available to it from loaded html pages and there doesn't seem to be an obvious way to add it in.

data.title: WebView.browserHost not getting generated in WebView.d.ts
data.body: It appears that the WebView.browserHost variable is not being emitted in the d.ts file.  This is located at the root of the namespace and not in an embedded class that gets parsed, so how can that be defined so that it gets picked up?   Would this require a custom WebViewWork.d.ts?
